{"step_by_step_thinking": "Lucatumumab is described as a monoclonal antibody in multiple documents, such as Document [0], Document [2], Document [4], Document [5], and Document [31]. Monoclonal antibodies are produced by identical immune cells that are all clones of a unique parent cell, whereas polyclonal antibodies are produced by several different types of immune cells. Therefore, if lucatumumab is a monoclonal antibody, it cannot be a polyclonal antibody.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
